text: So downloading files with the historic API is just totally broken right now, is that right?

elements.text: So downloading files with the historic API is just totally broken right now, is that right?

text:
If you have more than 1000 orders and call list_current_orders, is there a smart way to loop through and see how many records there are?

Or is the only way to set:

'from_record = 0
record_count = 0'

Then if the record count comes back as 1000, run it again from 1001 etc...

I am assuming there is a more efficient way to do it in a single call?

text: Can you use the order stream?

elements.text: Can you use the order stream?

text:
I'm trying to work out the best way to calc the initial position. From what I can see, the two obvious ways are:

Call initial_market_book, sum the matches and then adjust as new orders come in via the stream

or

Call current_order_list (for EXECUTION_COMPLETE), sum again and then adjust as new orders come in via the stream

Either works, but I wanted to go for the latter if possible, as then you can get the complete order info as a CurrentOrder object, whereas the Match object doesn't contain the complete order info.

Hence I was hoping I was being dumb and there's a simple way to do this.

elements.text:
I'm trying to work out the best way to calc the initial position. From what I can see, the two obvious ways are:

Call initial_market_book, sum the matches and then adjust as new orders come in via the stream

or

Call current_order_list (for EXECUTION_COMPLETE), sum again and then adjust as new orders come in via the stream

Either works, but I wanted to go for the latter if possible, as then you can get the complete order info as a CurrentOrder object, whereas the Match object doesn't contain the complete order info.

Hence I was hoping I was being dumb and there's a simple way to do this.

text: Actually one other way, that seems to be better is using list_market_books, using orders instead of matches and filtering on EXECUTION_COMPLETE, that approach gets most of the key info on each bet, although I can't see a way to filter on strategy...
